newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks seen continuing rebound at open.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks seen continuing rebound at open.

text.p: * Toronto stocks were expected to open on the plus side, continuing Monday's late-session rebound. * Eyes on surprise C$2.9 bln bid by Great-West Lifeco for London Insurance.
Toronto stocks were expected to open on the plus side on Tuesday, continuing Monday's late-session rebound.

MMS International technical analyst Katherine Beattie said yesterday's impressive rebound by Wall Street and more moderate Toronto rebound, coupled with stronger morning European markets bodes well for a strong open.
"And then we've got gold that's recovering at least a part of yesterday's drop, so I think we're going to open on the plus side and I think we could retrace yesterday's 40-point loss," Beattie said.
